wikipedia_page.main: Sir Edmund Hoyle Vestey, 1st Baronet (3 February 1866 – 18 November 1953) was an English food producer and importer and shipowner, and co-founder with his brother William of Vestey Brothers.

response: Sir Edmund Vestey, 1st Baronet, co-founder of the Blue Star Line, was the younger brother of the first Baron Vestey.
* Sir Edmund Vestey, 1st Baronet: Co-founder of Vestry group.
*Sir Edmund Vestey, 1st Baronet (1866–1957), English businessman, co-founder of Vestey Brothers and the Blue Star Line

A series of eight smaller statues was created in the 1980s.  One example at All Saints Church in Great Thurlow in Suffolk, in memory of Ronald Vestey, scion of the Vestey Brothers butchery empire: he was the son of Sir Edmund Vestey, 1st Baronet, and the father of Edmund Hoyle Vestey. Frink was born nearby, in Great Thurlow.
